titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Friederike Baer (NEH 2010)

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T20:11-0400

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: First three volumes are composed of entries from Philadelphia directories prior to 1800. An "F" preceding an entry means an advertisement for the person was found in a contemporary Philadelphia newspaper. The fourth volume is an alphabetical listing of all directory entries in TWO entirely separate alphabetical listings. The fifth volume contains entries taken from the file of advertisements published in newspapers of Philadelphia, Baltimore, Charleston, New York and Boston, prior to 1801, compiled by Alfred Coxe Prime for his work, Arts and Crafts in Phila...Walpole Society, 1929-1932.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Assembled by Phoebe Phillips Prime and Alfred Coxe Prime (from copy in possession of William Spawn), 1964.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This microfilm collection may be of interest to early American scholars.
